title: Mobile phone firms face disruption as Yahoo chatroom used to share numbers is shut down
text:
Mobile firms face difficulty sharing information about new UK phone numbers because an outdated online forum is being shut down.

A system set up by telecoms watchdog Ofcom to allow mobile phone providers to discuss who gets which new numbers has been running since 2002 as a private forum on Yahoo Groups, an internet discussion site from the early days of the web.

Yahoo announced this week that it plans to close much of this service on October 28, despite the continued use of the forum by mobile phone companies.

The phone group's page shows that it is still active, with 15 private messages sent by mobile phone providers so far this month and 35 sent in September.
